portfolio.title: Portfolio
portfolio.description: Some of my projects in development and design.

planning-scheduling.title: Planning & Scheduling
planning-scheduling.short: Operational planning system with drag-and-drop for AB InBev.
planning-scheduling.long: I worked on the frontend team building an operations planner in React. The app organizes large volumes of items by week/day using drag & drop, with Redux for state management and synchronization with corporate systems. The UI focuses on clarity, performance, and a smooth interactive experience.
planning-scheduling.challenge: Centralize weekly planning for thousands of items, reduce manual friction, and keep teams consistent.
planning-scheduling.solution: Weekly board with day columns, side backlog and drag-and-drop assignments; global state via Redux, client-side business validations, and sync with .NET services (including SAP integration).
features: Drag & drop across days and weeks
Responsive UI for desktop and mobile
process: Integration with C#/.NET API and error handling

scuti.title: Scuti
scuti.short: Growth ecosystem (Phase 1) focused on UI/UX and AI service integration.
scuti.long: I designed the UI/UX and developed the technical architecture for Scuti. The project is currently in Phase 1 (MVP), focusing on a high-performance interface integrated with AI APIs and email automation. This solid foundation is engineered to scale into a full on-chain validation ecosystem (Web3), which is currently in active development.
scuti.challenge: Designing a disruptive visual identity and a scalable architecture that allows for a smooth transition from a traditional web platform to a decentralized solution.
scuti.solution: Crafted the UI/UX design from scratch and developed using React/TypeScript. I implemented a modular service logic that facilitates future smart contract integration without compromising the current phase.
features: Original High-fidelity UI/UX Design and Prototyping
Phase 1: Functional MVP with React and TypeScript
AI Service integration for data processing
Scalable architecture ready for Web3 integration
Active Roadmap: Blockchain integration in progress
process: User Experience research and UI/UX design
Base structure development and TypeScript typing
Integration of external services (AI and Messaging)
Planning and environment setup for Web3 (Phase 2)
Phase 1 Launch and ongoing development of new features

Emaus-platform.title: Emaus Management Platform
Emaus-platform.short: Web app to manage members, activities and sales with an admin panel.
Emaus-platform.description: I built a React + Node platform that centralizes member records, activity calendar and registrations, plus a shop module with catalog, cart and inventory. It replaces manual WhatsApp/paper flows with digital processes, notifications and role-based control.
features: Information management: profiles, activity and purchase history
Activities: calendar, registrations and attendee lists
Store: product catalog, cart and sales reports
Emaus-platform.problem: Operations relied on manual processes: informal scheduling, non-centralized registrations and sales without inventory control, leading to delays and lack of traceability.
impact: Centralized data and automated key tasks

aether-uif.title: Aether UI Figma
aether-uif.short: Hybrid design system: clarity, structure, and elegance.
aether-uif.long: Aether UI is a design system created in Figma that blends the precision of Material UI with the visual sophistication of iOS aesthetics. It’s crafted for modern web products, with a focus on accessibility, modularity, scalability, and consistency.
aether-uif.challenge: Unifying visual standards without sacrificing creative freedom or flexibility in scalable products.
aether-uif.solution: Definition of universal design principles, a balanced and expressive color palette, and customizable visual components with semantic consistency.
features: Dual palette: Purple as base, deep blue as accent
process: Visual testing in dark and light contexts

aether-ui.title: Aether UI
aether-ui.short: Modular web design system with style guide, reusable components, and multilingual support.
aether-ui.long: Aether UI is a complete design system built with React and Vite. It includes design tokens (colors, typography, shadows), a library of customizable UI components, documentation pages, a visual style and accessibility guide, and UX/UI navigation. It supports multiple languages with i18next and offers ready-to-copy examples in JSX and CSS.
aether-ui.challenge: Build a reusable visual system that ensures design consistency, speeds up frontend development, and allows clear documentation.
aether-ui.solution: Modular and centralized structure combining styles, components, and guides. JSON-based translations, section navigation with React Router, and visual interactive examples for developers.
features: Reusable components: buttons, cards, dialogs, text fields
Live example and code view per component
Style guides: typography, color, accessibility, tone
process: Definition of tokens and base styles
Creation and documentation of UI components
Code viewer integration for JSX + CSS
Styling adjustments and testing on desktop/mobile
